turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Why are we stopping?

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: There's a dog in the road.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Go around him.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: There's not enough room.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Then run him over, he'll move.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Hey, he moved.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Let's get going before that thing tries to eat the car or something.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Well, I got some bad news and some bad news.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Fine. I'll go straight.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: What!

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Fine! I'll go straight!

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Forget it. I'll just go.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Screw that, no way, I ain't letting you go by yourself.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Don't worry, I'll be quick. Just stay here, no sense everybody getting drenched.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: I hope to Christ she doesn't expect us to wear these things.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Whatever it is just do it. The more we play along the faster we'll get the hell out of here.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Check this out.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Well, ya can't complain I never take you anyplace.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: This is starting to make me real uncomfortable.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Just sit back and enjoy the show.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: How much is a person supposed to stand?

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Quiet.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Oh, I'm sorry, bothering you? Was I disturbing your viewing pleasure?

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: What are you doing!

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: I gotta open the gate.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Drive through it!

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: It won't work.

turns.speaker: CAPT. SPAULDING
turns.text: Officers, officers what can I do for you today? I ain't fried up the birds yet... if that's what you're ring a ding dinging about.

turns.speaker: WYDELL
turns.text: What I need are some answers.

turns.speaker: CAPT. SPAULDING
turns.text: Well, I'll try but I don't know nothing 'bout nobody. I'm a guy who likes to mind his own business, if ya get what I'm saying.

turns.speaker: WYDELL
turns.text: You seen this girl? Say... within the last 24 hours.

turns.speaker: WYDELL
turns.text: Come on, get with the facts.

turns.speaker: CAPT. SPAULDING
turns.text: Hmmmmmmmmm?

turns.speaker: WYDELL
turns.text: What'd you see, who was she with, where were they going?

turns.speaker: CAPT. SPAULDING
turns.text: Aw, she was with some nosey, smartass high-rise kids. They were poking around... asking stupid questions.

turns.speaker: WYDELL
turns.text: And...

turns.speaker: CAPT. SPAULDING
turns.text: And I gave 'em directions out there, up by the old farm row... I figured what's the harm. Stupid kids probably going out to piss up a rope and got themselves turned around backasswards and got lost as shit.

turns.speaker: WYDELL
turns.text: Is that all... think real hard.

turns.speaker: CAPT. SPAULDING
turns.text: Yeah, they weren't here but a few minutes, didn't really have time to get as up close and personal as I do with most of the assholes that wander through here.

turns.speaker: WYDELL
turns.text: How's about you give me those same directions.

turns.speaker: CAPT. SPAULDING
turns.text: Yeah, yeah, sure. You don't have to get all True Grit all over my ass... I'll give'm to ya... you can knock yourself silly for all I care.

turns.speaker: WYDELL
turns.text: Enough talk, write.

turns.speaker: STUCKY
turns.text: I... I got back a stack today. Some nice shots.  See, a good topless June Wilkinson... unfortunately she personalized it...  to Stucky, love June.

turns.speaker: CAPT. SPAULDING
turns.text: Hmmmmm.

turns.speaker: STUCKY
turns.text: Shit, this ain't worth nothing now that my name gotten all over it. I was a fixin' on trading it to Jackie Cobb.

turns.speaker: CAPT. SPAULDING
turns.text: The retard over at Molly's fruit stand.

turns.speaker: STUCKY
turns.text: Yeah, he's all hot on her after he found some of his dad's old nudie books hidden in the basement. He keeps 'em taped inside his school workbook.

turns.speaker: CAPT. SPAULDING
turns.text: Fascinating.

turns.speaker: STUCKY
turns.text: That kid is one horny retard.

turns.speaker: CAPT. SPAULDING
turns.text: Christ, ain't they all. All them retards wanna do is fuck and eat.

turns.speaker: STUCKY
turns.text: Well, yeah... I think that if you knew him... I mean if you'd understand his urges, shit the guy's like forty or something.

turns.speaker: CAPT. SPAULDING
turns.text: Worse than a fucking rabid baboon.

turns.speaker: STUCKY
turns.text: Yeah, I guess, you know next to wacking his weasel his other favorite thing is twisting sharpened pencils in the corner of his eyes.

turns.speaker: CAPT. SPAULDING
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: STUCKY
turns.text: Yeah, doesn't hurt himself, just spins it around next to his eyeball.

turns.speaker: CAPT. SPAULDING
turns.text: I'm sure that ain't the only place he's sticking those pencils.

turns.speaker: STUCKY
turns.text: Naw, he don't do anything else with 'em, but he did get caught once with a Planet of the Apes doll hanging out his asshole.

turns.speaker: CAPT. SPAULDING
turns.text: Goddamn.

turns.speaker: STUCKY
turns.text: Had to take him to the hospital. Kid had Dr. Zaius stuck half way up his butt, couldn't get it out.

turns.speaker: CAPT. SPAULDING
turns.text: I always loved that mute broad that Chuck Heston was shacking up with.

turns.speaker: STUCKY
turns.text: Nova, yeah she looked pretty sweet.

turns.speaker: CAPT. SPAULDING
turns.text: Yeah, now there's the perfect woman.

turns.speaker: STUCKY
turns.text: Can I get some stamps off ya?  Did you fix the toilet yet?

turns.speaker: CAPT. SPAULDING
turns.text: Ya hear me? You bust that crapper and I'll beat your ass.

turns.speaker: STUCKY
turns.text: I hear ya.

turns.speaker: CAPT. SPAULDING
turns.text: Fuck your grandmother.

turns.speaker: STUCKY
turns.text: Yeah, I remember Mr. Alacard the shop teacher use'ta call you Little Dick Wick. Hey, wasn't there a song we made up to go with that?

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: Huh? Oh, hi. You really don't have a phone?

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: No, none. I had one once, back in '57 maybe... I don't know. Really ain't nobody we wanna be jaw flapping at around here no more.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: No, he's just joking. We don't really have any plans other than spending the night at my Dad's house...  ...which is where we were headed when our car broke down.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: That's nice.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: Yeah, I guess I'll just help him hand out candy to the trick or treaters.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: How long is that gonna take?

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: He should be back in a couple hours.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Tiny ain't got no car, he ain't even got a bicycle.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: How's he get around out here?

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: You sure you don't need any help in there?

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: No dear, I'm fine. Now what kind of host would I be if I put my guests to this kind of work.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: You'll have to forgive Tiny, he can't hear so much.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Yeah, my poor baby. It's his Daddy's fault. I mean Earl was a good man... I mean he never hit me or nothing, but one day he just got up and went pure devil on us all.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: What happened? Oh, I'm sorry, it's none of my business.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: He tried to burn the house down, said it was possessed by the spirits. Tiny was sleeping in the basement where the fire started. I don't think Earl ever meant to harm us... but Tiny was badly burnt, his ears were destroyed and most of his skin.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Grab Mary and come inside.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Great, you're back. Let's go. We already paid for the tickets.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: Tickets for what?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: This isn't everything. Get ready for this... there's a Museum of Murder and Mayhem.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: I don't want to see that.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Aw, come on. It will be fun.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: Oh yeah, murder museum... sounds fun.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: Ugh, what's that smell?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Fried chicken.  Anybody want some?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Hey, maybe she knows where this is?

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: That seems likely.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: Fuck, it's freezing.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Hey, listen to this... I think this is related to our Dr. Satan.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: Oh, yeah.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yeah, in this book there's a chapter called Self Made Freaks about how people would mutilate themselves in order to work in a freak show. It mostly talks about tattooed people and wild men of Borneo and shit like that, but there is one mention of a single case where a woman was suspected of having her arms removed on purpose to become an arm-less wonder.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: Yeah, so how does that fit with the story of four morons with a flat tire looking for a dead tree?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: It says, "records show that Ellie Thompson was born in 1914 of normal physical stature and lived a life of normal bearings, until such time that she was placed in the care of the Willows State Mental Facility."

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: So.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Now she was put in the nuthouse in 1930 at the age of 16.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Blah, blah, blah... it doesn't say, but she was released sometime in 1937, only to reappear as Ellie Bogdan, the arm-less wonder. Says she, "criss-crossed the United States constantly in carnivals and freak shows until her death in 1946."

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: These dates perfectly correspond with the time frame of our beloved Dr. Satan working at the looney bin. I'll bet he amputated her arms.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: So what?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I don't know, I just thought it was interesting.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: You know what Jerry, who really cares at this point?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I don't...  ...I just thought it was weird.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: Yeah, Jerry, she said some pretty fucked shit to us.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: When?

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: When you were outside with Bill.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Hey, nice outfit Billy Bob.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: Thanks for coming to get us. Little brother almost scared us to death.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Dude, your chick's a little high strung.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Yes, thank you. Thank you very much.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: Really, now is not the time to make waves.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Hey, I'm just waiting for Cousin Itt to show up.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: Shhhhhh.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: What are you laughing at?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I don't know, I think he's funny.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: This isn't funny, it's twisted.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: You gotta be kidding me. This chick is wasted.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Shhhhhh.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: We've got get out of here, we got get out of here.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Think, think. Try to open the lid, try to kick a hole in the wood.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: I can't... I can't move my arms. I hurt so much.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I know, but we can make it out of here. We can do it.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: That was good babe, just keep doing that.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: That's not me. I didn't... I'm not doing that.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Someone is out there...  ...help, we're in here!

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: Help, help us.

turns.speaker: MR. WILLIS
turns.text: Hello...  ...hey Denise... what, what's wrong, did you break down?

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: No, nothing like that... yeah, we're gonna be a little late. We stopped for gas at this place called Capt. Spaulding's outside of Ruggsville and it turned into a whole thing, so we're kind of behind schedule.

turns.speaker: MR. WILLIS
turns.text: Oh yeah, yeah I've driven by that place before. I seem to remember a crabby old bastard in a crummy clown suit running the place.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: Yeah, well he's still here. I think him and Jerry are fast becoming buddies, you know Jerry... yeah, he's gotta see everything... yeah, I know... thinks there's some unsolved mystery around every corner.

turns.speaker: MR. WILLIS
turns.text: Well, don't take too long, the kids are already knocking down the door demanding their sugar fix... I know, I know I forgot to mention that Halloween falls on a school night, so they're trick or treating tonight... I got the joint decked out this year, built a graveyard in the front yard like when you were a kid.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: Hopefully I can move things along here and make up the lost time by speeding all the way home... yes, Dad I'm kidding.

turns.speaker: MR. WILLIS
turns.text: Well, just promise me you'll be careful... alright, alright see ya soon... good-bye.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: Come on sleeping beauty, time to go to work.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Sleeping.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: Rise and shine.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: No please, let me sit this one out.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: Let's go. You're the one who wanted to be a photographer.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: I resign.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: Too late. You're in for life, let's move it out Private Shutterbug.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Christ, I hope this isn't more crappy folk art. It's so quaint... it's so primal... it's so crap.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: Aw, it ain't crap... it's... cute.  ...and really who are we to judge the artistic merit of the tin-can Mona Lisa?

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Aw, shit...  I gotta pee anyway.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: I swear I've aged five years since this trip started.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Tell me about it.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: God, I hate falling asleep in the afternoon. Now I'll be up all night...  ...ugh, my back is killing me.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Yeah, hey how far do you think we are from your Dad's?

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: It will be nice to have a few days off to regenerate. This trip is fun, but it's starting to get brutal.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: Yeah, I hit burn out mode back at that old stripper lady's place. Watching her dance around with those ratty-looking animals was ridiculous.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: I know, that was some crazy shit. I never in a million years would have believed it if I hadn't seen it.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: A decent meal every once in a while wouldn't hurt either, this road food is crap.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: If I never eat at another Waffle House again, I can die a happy girl.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: Scattered, smothered and covered.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Exactly... well, I guess a couple more photos won't kill me.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Geez, he never gets tired does he.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: Never. I swear to God he never sleeps, he goes to bed after me, wakes up before me. He's always working on 10.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Maybe he's a cyborg.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Let's just skip it. It is probably nothing anyway.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: Aw Christ, Jerry. We can't see anything now, it's too dark. Let's forget it.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: Stick her in the front, if you want to pick her up so bad. She's soaked.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: She looks like she stinks.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Don't even say it.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: You got to be fucking joking.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: God damn it, I knew this witch-hunt was fucking bullshit.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: I think I'm going fucking crazy.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: I can't believe...

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: She said we look like pussy lickers or some shit like that.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: Yeah, she said we looked queer.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: How long has it been?

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: I don't know... about half an hour.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: What was that?

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: What? I didn't hear anything.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Wait... quiet. Turn off the radio.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: I don't hear anything.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: Shhhhhh, quiet.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: I still don't.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: Turn on the headlights. See if anything is out there.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: Jesus Christ.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: I think I'm gonna have a fucking heart attack.

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: Excuse me, may I please use your phone?

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Bill, why don't you ask her... she's your special friend.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: A couple hours!

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: Can't Tiny drive us to a phone?

turns.speaker: DENISE
turns.text: Don't be such a fucking smart ass.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Yeah, it's really your fault that we're stuck in this shithole in the first place.

turns.speaker: HUSTON
turns.text: What'd we here, Georgie?

turns.speaker: WYDELL
turns.text: A vehicle registered to a William S. Hudley.

turns.speaker: HUSTON
turns.text: Holy Jesus, somebody had themselves a field day beating the shit outta this thing.

turns.speaker: WYDELL
turns.text: Yeah, no mercy here.

turns.speaker: HUSTON
turns.text: Recover any bodies?

turns.speaker: WYDELL
turns.text: Not yet.

turns.speaker: HUSTON
turns.text: Shit, I wonder what these kids did to bring this much hell down on 'em.

turns.speaker: WYDELL
turns.text: Just in the wrong place at the wrong time.

turns.speaker: HUSTON
turns.text: That's the understatement of the year.

turns.speaker: WYDELL
turns.text: Yep, I suppose it is.

turns.speaker: WYDELL
turns.text: God damn.

turns.speaker: HUSTON
turns.text: You find something, Georgie?

turns.speaker: WYDELL
turns.text: Yep, I found something.

turns.speaker: HUSTON
turns.text: What'd ya got there?

turns.speaker: NAISH
turns.text: Keys.

turns.speaker: HUSTON
turns.text: Well Christ boy, don't stand there like a prize dog dick with his butthole caught up a tree.

turns.speaker: NAISH
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: HUSTON
turns.text: Open up the trunk.

turns.speaker: NAISH
turns.text: Yes, sir.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Hey, maybe the guy with the tow truck could drive us to a phone.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: His name is Rufus, Rufus Jr., but we all call him R.J.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Oh, right.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: What do they call you, sweety?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Um, I'm Jerry... that's Bill... Denise and Mary.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: So, what brings you kids way out here, ain't you got something better to do for Halloween than wander around out here in the sticks?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Well, I thought I'd maybe take in a hoedown.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Oh, really...  ...well, I'm a pretty good dancer if you know what I mean... I bet I got a few moves you ain't never seen.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I don't doubt that.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: And I'm gonna help put the razor blades in the candy apples.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: I'll bet you are... you are a naughty little thing aren't ya.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I was just kidding.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Great. I thought I felt a certain attraction between Mary and Tiny soon as he walked in.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Maybe. He's a real lady killer.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Didn't ya think, Mary?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I've been meaning to ask you, Mrs... Ummmm.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Firefly.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Firefly... mmmmm odd name. Mrs. Firefly, do you know anything about the legend of Dr. Satan?

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: For the show. It's Halloween eve and time for our show.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Oh, you mean on TV.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: No, no, no it's so much more special than that... you'll see, you'll be the first to ever see. I think this is something you'll really love.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Great.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Bye sweety, we could of been great together.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Please, let us go, we won't tell anybody.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Aw, honey you know I can't do that.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I'm gonna go ask him.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Aw, come on Jerry. We've gotten all we're gonna get out of this place and its starting to rain.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Shit, it is only sprinkling and it's worth the trouble. Hold on for two seconds.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: We hit the jackpot! Let's roll, good buddy. We got ourselves a convoy.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Just back up.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I think we should go straight. I mean we know for a fact there ain't nothing back that way, right?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I'll go. It's my fault.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: You said it, not me.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: God damn it, I must be fucking crazy to let him go off with that crazy fucking bitch.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: That stupid hillbilly slut.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Oh, don't blow everything out of proportion.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: You didn't see the look she threw me. She's up to something.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Hold on, hold on! Everybody calm down! It's the tow truck guy.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: What!

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: OK lassies, I think it's time you get to gripping reality.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Enough with the stupid voices.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: This is way too fucked up for words.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: I know the words... fucking psycho fucking bullshit, that's the words.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: I'm with Denise, can't we just walk to someplace, this is getting fucking stupid.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Negative. Shit, we are so deep in the sticks we could walk for hours and find zero.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Oh, I get it... I guess you think you're too good for the simple pleasures of Halloween.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: No, just a little too old.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Oh really, well I hope something changes your mind some day.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: I know you're my guests and welcome but I'd please advise you to keep from cussing while in my house, thank you.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Well, even though I know it seems childish to you all. Tonight is Halloween eve and it special to us so you are all invited to stay for dinner.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: I suggest you kids leave now.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Don't worry, I'm gone.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Why? Why are you doing this?

turns.speaker: OTIS
turns.text: Doing what? Messy up your day? Well, fuck lady there are some bigger issues at hand... than your fucking have a nice fucking day bumper sticker shit!

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Where's Bill?

turns.speaker: OTIS
turns.text: Well, Bill... he's a good guy, he's been great help to me... a real blessing... I couldn't have asked for a better specimen. I mean you don't know what a dry spell I've had, total block...  ...total block... but Bill he's OK.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Where is he?

turns.speaker: OTIS
turns.text: Let's go see.

turns.speaker: OTIS
turns.text: Behold... The Fish-Boy!

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: This can't be real, this can't be real, this can't be real.

turns.speaker: OTIS
turns.text: Oh, it's real... as real as I want it to be, mamma...  ...look, see the magic in my brush strokes.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Fuck you, you fucking freak!

turns.speaker: OTIS
turns.text: Oh, come now... we're all creatures of God and freaks in our own way...  ...but if you'll notice...  right here, needs a little something, heh?

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: What are you doing?  ...no, stop... please, please.

turns.speaker: OTIS
turns.text: You, my dear worm feeder, are about to become immortalized.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Well hello, officer.

turns.speaker: WYDELL
turns.text: Excuse me, I'm sorry for disturbing you this fine afternoon.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Aw, you ain't disturbing me, but it kind of looks like rain, don't ya think?

turns.speaker: WYDELL
turns.text: My name is Lt. Wydell, I'd like to ask you a few questions.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Questions? Well, heck, I'll tell you anything you want to know.

turns.speaker: WYDELL
turns.text: I appreciate your cooperation. I'm looking for a missing girl...  ...this girl here, Denise Willis... have you seen her?

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Well, I... mmmmm... no, I ain't seen her, sorry.

turns.speaker: WYDELL
turns.text: Please, could I please come in and talk to you for a minute? Maybe you could take a better look at the picture... might stir up something.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: I um... no, I don't think so...

turns.speaker: WYDELL
turns.text: Please, just a minute.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Oh, alright... I guess I can trust you... being a man of the law and all.

turns.speaker: WYDELL
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Oh, you are very welcome... Lord knows how I love a man in uniform.

turns.speaker: WYDELL
turns.text: Think... do any of these kids look familiar in any way?

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: No, I can't say that I ever seen 'em before...  ...he looks familiar, is he on TV?

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Grampa... watch the language.

turns.speaker: OTIS
turns.text: I ain't sure that you really need to know. It's better you go home still dreaming about your kitty cats and puppy dogs.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Otis! Otis! Come quick, there's cops outside.

turns.speaker: OTIS
turns.text: What! God damn, how many?

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: I don't know. I only saw one.

turns.speaker: OTIS
turns.text: I'm sure there's more than that... fucking pigs always travel in packs...  ...here, take this.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: What should I do?

turns.speaker: OTIS
turns.text: Go down stairs and play nice... I'm a gonna go 'round back and handle things like I always fucking do.

turns.speaker: OTIS
turns.text: I'm the one who brings the devil's brandy...

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Who's your Daddy!

turns.speaker: OTIS
turns.text: Yes! I'm the one who beats you when you're bad...

turns.speaker: OTIS
turns.text: Get in... now!

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Wait, I want to say good-bye.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: That's true, Otis... not that we're having a bad time, but...

turns.speaker: OTIS
turns.text: Well, go get her.

turns.speaker: NAISH
turns.text: Hey.

turns.speaker: MR. WILLIS
turns.text: George Willis...  ...any leads?

turns.speaker: NAISH
turns.text: Local girl, Karen Murphy, been missing for a couple months, figured for a runaway.

turns.speaker: MR. WILLIS
turns.text: Fit the profile?

turns.speaker: NAISH
turns.text: No, not really. Good kid, never been in any trouble.

turns.speaker: MR. WILLIS
turns.text: Christ, four kids couldn't just disappear.

turns.speaker: NAISH
turns.text: No they couldn't, somebody had to see something.

turns.speaker: MR. WILLIS
turns.text: My Denise is a smart girl, she wouldn't do anything stupid, and her boyfriend, he always seemed like a good kid.

turns.speaker: NAISH
turns.text: Turn up this road.

turns.speaker: MR. WILLIS
turns.text: Where we headed?

turns.speaker: NAISH
turns.text: Shit, don't these packrat hillbillies throw anything away?

turns.speaker: MR. WILLIS
turns.text: Shhhh... you hear that?

turns.speaker: NAISH
turns.text: Yeah, I hear it... where's it coming from?

turns.speaker: MR. WILLIS
turns.text: Over here, inside the smokehouse.

turns.speaker: MR. WILLIS
turns.text: We gotta break it open.

turns.speaker: NAISH
turns.text: I ain't got a warrant.

turns.speaker: MR. WILLIS
turns.text: Tell it to my daughter.

turns.speaker: NAISH
turns.text: Shit... fuck procedure.
